sen.j: 碧雲荘（へきうんそう）は、日本の実業家である二代目野村徳七（のむらとくしち）が、大正時代から昭和時代にかけて京都市・南禅寺付近に築造した数寄屋造りの別邸。
sen.e: Hekiunso, located near Nanzen-ji Temple in Kyoto City, is a Sukiya-zukuri style (built in the style of a tea- ceremony house) villa that was constructed by a Japanese businessman Tokushichi Nomura the second during the period from Taisho to Showa era.

Hekiunso, located near Nanzen-ji Temple in Kyoto City, is a Sukiya-zukuri style (built in the style of a tea- ceremony house) villa that was constructed by a Japanese businessman Tokushichi Nomura, the second during the period from the Taisho to the Showa era.

Hekiunso, located near Nanzen-ji Temple in Kyoto City, is a Sukiya-zukuri style (built in the style of a tea- ceremony house) villa that was constructed by a Japanese businessman Tokushichi NOMURA, the second during the period from the Taisho (1912 - 1926) to the Showa (1926 - 1989) periods.

sen.j: 「野村碧雲荘」とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also called "Nomura Hekiunso".
It is also called "Nomura Hekiunso."
It is also called 'Nomura Hekiunso.'
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: 2006年12月19日、国の重要文化財に指定された。
sen.e: It was designated as a national important cultural property as of December 19, 2006.
It was designated as a national important cultural property as of December 19, 2006.
It was designated as a national important cultural property as of December 19, 2006.

sen.j: 北村捨次郎らの設計による、数寄屋造りの高度な技法を凝らして作られた建築物と、近代日本庭園の先駆者である小川治兵衛が作った美しい庭園がある。
sen.e: This villa is composed of buildings which were constructed by incorporating advanced technique of Sukiya-zukuri based on the design of Sutejiro KITAMURA etc. and a beautiful garden which was designed by Jihei OGAWA, a pioneering engineer of modern Japanese garden.

This villa is composed of buildings constructed by incorporating advanced the technique of Sukiya-zukuri based upon the design of Sutejiro KITAMURA, etc. and a beautiful garden which was designed by Jihei OGAWA, a pioneering engineer of modern Japanese gardens.

This villa is composed of buildings constructed by incorporating advanced the technique of Sukiya-zukuri based upon the design of Sutejiro KITAMURA and so on, and a beautiful garden which was designed by Jihei OGAWA, a pioneering engineer of modern Japanese gardens.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 大正時代から建築が始まり、昭和3年（1928年）頃に完成した。
sen.e: Its construction work started in the Taisho era and was completed around 1928.
Its construction work started in the Taisho era and was completed around 1928.
Its construction work started in the Taisho period and was completed around 1928.

sen.j: 以下の17棟と土地が国の重要文化財に指定されている。
sen.e: 17 buildings shown below and the land were designated as important national cultural properties.
sen.cmt: 以下の建築物名は固有名詞を除き、全て定訳不明のため、仮訳しております。
sen.e: 17 buildings shown below and the land were designated as important national cultural properties.
17 buildings shown below and the land were designated as important national cultural properties.

sen.j: 大玄関及び能舞台（東面車寄、西面渡廊下、北面便所付属、南面東端塀、北面東端門及び塀付き）（附去来門、供待）
sen.e: A grand entrance and a Noh stage (inclusive of the east-facing driveway apron, the west-facing roofed passage, the north-facing lavatory, the south-facing east fence, the north-facing east gate and the fence) (hukyoraimon, tomozamurai)
sen.cmt: 附去来門、供待→読み、定訳不明。
sen.e: A grand entrance and a Noh stage (inclusive of the east-facing driveway apron, the west-facing roofed passage, the north-facing lavatory, the south-facing east fence, the north-facing east gate and the fence) (hukyoraimon, tomozamurai)

sen.j: 大書院（西面渡廊下付属）

Daishoin (large drawing room) (inclusive of the west-facing roofed passage)

sen.j: 中書院
sen.e: Chu-shoin (middle-sized drawing room)
Chu-shoin (middle-sized drawing room)
Chushoin (middle-sized drawing room)

sen.j: 洋室及び書斎（東面渡廊下付属）

The western style room and the study (inclusive of the east-facing roofed passage)
The western style room and the study (inclusive of the east-facing roofed passage)

Rokagura (storeroom on a corridor) (inclusive of the south-facing corridor)

The old building (Hokusenkyo) (inclusive of the west-facing gate, the south projection of the west-facing gate and the fence)

Daidokorogura (storeroom in a kitchen)

sen.j: 土地 17,339.35㎡（石垣、南門、北門、旧館南側門、迎仙橋、西門前水路、塀を含む）
